shows.name: Naruto Shippuden
shows.review: Literally the best anime ever! Can you truly call yourself a weeb if you have never watched Naruto?!!

shows.name: Attack on Titan
shows.review: Easily one of the greatest productions to ever come out, pure perfection, no plot holes or character flaws. A true Crown Jewel if you will.

shows.name: Haikyuu!!
shows.review: Very wholesome, cute and adorable. Never thought I'd get into a sports anime but it was nice, makes me want to play volleyball.

shows.name: My Hero Academia
shows.review: The show is nice or whatever but the fanbase scares me, giving it a 2/5 because of that lol

shows.name: Jujutsu Kaisen
shows.review: Loveeee this anime!! It has been a while since I watched an anime that gave me the same vibes as Naruto! I mean an active kid with a demon inside of him and is being hunted by everyone, whose teacher has grey hair, a mask, and is one of the strongest of all time. Immaculate fight scenes I would give it a 10/5 if I could!

shows.name: Demon Slayer
shows.review: A determined brother that would do anything to protect his sister, misunderstood demons and a whole lotta slaying. If you love animes with a lot more tradtional sword fighting this is the one for you.

movies.name: Your Name
movies.review: From the visual art to the story plot, it very aesthetically pleasing and made me a little emotional.

movies.name: Howl's Moving Castle
movies.review: Studio Ghibli never misses! This was one of my absolute favorite movies and a staple in my DVD collection.

movies.name: Wolf Children
movies.review: Within the first few minutes it was already emotional, the changes the characters went through to find their true selves was so beautiful to watch.

movies.name: Cowboy Bebop: The Movie
movies.review: If you love the classic show you will love the movie!

movies.name: Hunter X Hunter: Phantom Rouge
movies.review: It was ok, the show is so much better but this was just ok. Wish the creator would finish the manga or sell it to someone else to finish it *sigh*

movies.name: Spirited Away
movies.review: If you have never watched Spirited Away you are either lying or missing out! It is one of the best!!!!!

videogames.name: Dragon Ball FighterZ
videogames.review: Finishing off a foe by kicking them right into a mountain evokes memories of the anime’s most epic clashes.

videogames.name: Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4 – Road to Boruto
videogames.review: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4 brought back the beloved Ultimate Jutsu and Awakenings battle mechanics, plus it increased the game’s already high fun factor with the ability to switch between characters mid-battle.

videogames.name: .hack//G.U. Last Recode
videogames.review: The crisp anime visuals got even crispier, the battle mechanics/game pacing were thankfully enhanced.

videogames.name: Mobile Suit Gundam Extreme Vs. Maxiboost ON
videogames.review: The battle mechanics at the heart of this mech brawler feel like a natural evolution of SEGA’s Virtual-On games, plus its wealth of single and multiplayer content makes it much more valuable than your average anime arena fighter.

videogames.name: Granblue Fantasy: Versus
videogames.review: Versus is easy on the eyes and easy to play, but its complexities will surprise you and keep you playing it for longer than expected.

videogames.name: Fairy Tail
videogames.review: There’s a satisfying amount of characters to bring into your stable, a unique battle system, catchy music, and side missions galore.
